availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Dishman practiced law in Barbourville, Knox County and was named the Commonwealth's Attorney for Jessamine County before the Civil War. A Confederate sympathizer, he resided in Lexington during the war. He was named the Commonwealth's Attorney for a mountain district including Laurel County after the Civil War.

bibl.p: Find A Grave, "John Dishman (June 23, 1820-May 3, 1894)," Memorial #15309240, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=Dishman&GSfn=John&GSbyrel=all&GSdyrel=all&GSst=19&GScntry=4&GSob=n&GRid=15309240&df=all& (accessed June 18, 2017); Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox, Barbourville, p. 36; William Elsey Connelley and E. M. Coulter, History of Kentucky, vol. 5 (Chicago: The American Historical Society, 1922), 423.
